alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 9:30AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WESTERN UNION AND EASTERN COLUMBIA COUNTIES...CLAIBORNE AND NORTHWESTERN LINCOLN PARISHES THROUGH 1015 AM CDT... At 930 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Village, or 13 miles southeast of Magnolia, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Magnolia, Homer, Smackover, Junction City, McNeil, Haynesville, Emerson, Mount Holly, Atlanta, Wesson, Village, Lisbon, Calhoun, Newell, Laughlin, Spotville, Medlock, Lake Clairborne, Corinth, and Hew Hope. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
